description: Borrowing from New Latin choana, from Ancient Greek χοᾰ́νη (khoánē, “funnel”), from χέω (khéō, “to pour”) +‎ -ᾰ́νη (-ánē, suffix for utensil names).

entries.meaning: A funnel or funnel-shaped opening; an infundibulum.
(anatomy, zootomy) A pair of apertures towards the back of the nasal cavity, opening into the nasopharynx.
examples: Synonyms: internal nostril, posterior naris, posterior nasal aperture
